title: Sikh Lawyer Who Was Bullied For His 'Brown Skin' May Just Become The King Maker In Canada
text:
Sikh Lawyer Who Was Bullied For His 'Brown Skin' May Just Become The King Maker In Canada

Sikh Lawyer Who Was Bullied For His 'Brown Skin' May Just Become The King Maker In Canada

Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is set for a second term despite his Liberal party not getting a clear majority. His Liberal party will be needing outside support that paves way for a minority government. The support will most-likely be from fourth-placed left-leaning New Democratic Party (NDP) led by 40-year-old human rights lawyer Jagmeet Singh, a report in the Times of India said.

AFP

Jagmeet Singh is the same politician who had grabbed eyeballs after his party New Democratic Party (NDP) became the front-runner in challenging current Canadian PM Trudeau-led Liberals party.

"I'm hoping that Mr Trudeau respects the fact that there's a minority government now, which means we've got to work together", said Singh who was quoted to as saying by TOI.

In the House of Commons, Trudeau's Liberals fell short of the 170-seat margin for the majority in the 338-seat. The Liberals managed to win 157 seats, a number reduced by 20 seats in comparison to their last percentage.

Singh's NDP won 24 seats which could be crucial in forming the majority given Trudeau gets the requisite support from the Indian-origin politician.

Thank you, Canada 🇨🇦

What a night – and what an unforgettable journey this campaign has been.

With our new NDP caucus in Ottawa, I'm incredibly excited to continue our critical work to achieve the priorities that we’ve heard from people across this country. #elxn43 #ElectionDay — Jagmeet Singh (@theJagmeetSingh) October 22, 2019

Singh too lost 20 seats against his party's 44 seats last time around.

Singh's ascent to the top political scene in Canada was no fluke. He was often bullied for his brown skin and long hair.

He received global attention in 2017 after a video from his campaign event, 'Jagmeet and Greet', went viral on social media where he was seen trying to calm an outraged woman who was heckling him about Muslim Brotherhood and Sharia law.

Singh ignored the racial comments hurled at him and tried to diffuse the situation saying, "We are not going to be intimidated by hatred." He countered the woman with his campaign motto of 'love and courage'.
